lead_paragraph: The American Psychological Association has been asked to revisit its “blanket prohibition” on the involvement of psychologists in national security interrogations.
snippet: The American Psychological Association has been asked to revisit its “blanket prohibition” on the involvement of psychologists in national security interrogations.

headline.main: Pentagon Wants Psychologists to End Ban on Interrogation Role
headline.print_headline: Psychologists Are Asked to End Interrogation Ban

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

abstract: Defense Dept requests that American Psychological Assn revisit blanket prohibition on presence of psychologists in national security interrogations; 2015 ban followed release of report revealing influential psychologists had helped cover up harsh interrogation program used by Central Intelligence Agency at Guantanamo Bay prison; Pentagon officials express support for ethics guidelines in use of psychologists but say blanket prohibition is counterproductive in meeting national security needs.
